title: World Geography Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of world geography and capitals
subject: geography

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia. While Sydney and Melbourne are larger cities, Canberra was specifically planned and built to be the national capital.

questions.question: Which river is the longest in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River in Africa is generally considered the longest river in the world at approximately 4,135 miles (6,650 km), though there's some debate with the Amazon.

questions.question: The Sahara Desert is larger than the continental United States.
questions.explanation: Yes, the Sahara Desert covers about 3.5 million square miles, while the continental US covers about 3 million square miles.

questions.question: Which mountain range contains Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is located in the Himalayas on the border between Nepal and Tibet (China).

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest sovereign nation in the world, covering only about 0.17 square miles (0.44 square kilometers).

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest by surface area?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean, covering about one-third of the Earth's surface and containing more than half of the world's ocean water.

questions.question: Brazil is the only South American country where Portuguese is the official language.
questions.explanation: Yes, Brazil is the only Portuguese-speaking country in South America. All other South American countries primarily speak Spanish, except for Guyana (English), Suriname (Dutch), and French Guiana (French).

questions.question: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of which country?
questions.explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the northeastern coast of Australia in the Coral Sea, stretching over 2,300 kilometers.
